I am imploring non-CNBC Club Members to subscribe to get my Sunday think piece which i think explains so much of what is happening right now

In 1973 the Yom Kippur war and the subsequent oil embargo brought the S&P 500 down 15% almost immediately as stagflation hit the U.S.  So different this time. The real increase has occurred in the domestic natural gas market, totally unrelated to this war as oil has held steady

In 1973 the U.S. produced 9.2 million barrels of oil a day. Now it is over 13 million barrels. Meanwhile Russia is flooding the world with oil and OPEC is a shadow of its former self. That could be the linchpin that explains how you could still have a bull market in September of

Those of us old enough to recall the Yom Kippur War in 1973, remember the four-fold increase in oil from an OPEC embargo, admittedly off a very small base. This time there is no Egypt or Syrian invasion where Egypt had superior weaponry backed by the Soviet Union
